p: We employed the maximum entropy algorithm (MaxEnt 3.3.3k), one of the best performing approaches in modeling species distribution, with presence‐only data (Elith & Yates, 2015) to construct the habitat suitability for R. roxellana under the current day scenario and then projected the spatial information into the 2050s. We used the default settings for the MaxEnt model (Phillips, Anderson, & Schapire, 2006), with the exception of dividing the percentage at 75% of the occurrence data into training set for model construction and the percentage at 25% into a random test set for evaluation of model performance. We conducted a subsampling procedure with 15 replicates (Khatchikian, Sangermano, Kendell, & Livdahl, 2011).
